text: Suppose you are designing a Go-Back-N sliding window protocol operating between a sender and a receiver over a full- duplex error-free 1-GBps link which has a one-way latency of 100ms. Assuming that each frame carries 10KB of data and the size of the acknowledgement frame is negligible, then to achieve a link utilization of 100%, what is the minimum number of bits you need for the sequence number field? (You can assume 1KB = 10° bytes, and 1GB = 10° bytes)
